conclusion: Trying to solve a problem about a charged particle moving through an electric and magnetic field.
Understanding the setup: square region ABCD with side length 2L, uniform magnetic field perpendicular to the plane, two parallel metal plates MN and PQ with a uniform electric field between them.
Negatively charged particle injected along central line SO of the plates, moves in a straight line, fails to exit magnetic field from side CD.
Electric and magnetic fields are balancing each other out in the region between the plates since the particle moves in a straight line.
Magnetic field mentioned in the entire square region, electric field between plates MN and PQ.
Electric force and magnetic force must be balancing each other out in the region between the plates.
Magnetic force on a moving charge is qvB, direction is perpendicular to q, v, and B.
Electric force is qE, direction opposite to electric field for negative charges.
Electric and magnetic forces balancing implies qE = qvB.
Particle moving along central line SO, perpendicular to plates MN and PQ.
First image shows square with points A, B, C, D, plates MN and PQ inside, magnetic field represented by crosses.
Particle injected along SO, central line between MN and PQ.
Second image shows red arrow indicating velocity v of particle entering magnetic field.
Particle passes through region between MN and PQ, then enters region with only magnetic field.
Electric and magnetic forces balancing implies E = vB.
Region outside plates has only magnetic field B.
Particle moves in circular path due to magnetic field after passing through plates.
Problem states particle just fails to exit magnetic field from side CD.
Circular path should just tangent to side CD.
Radius of circular path should be such that particle just touches side CD.
Side length of square is 2L, particle starts from point S, midpoint of side AB.
Point S is starting point, along SO is central line between MN and PQ, L units apart.
MN coincides with left half of side AD.
